dt: {bc}a straight groove or channel in the barrel of an auger

shortdef: a bit socket in a brace
a straight groove or channel in the barrel of an auger

dt: {bc}a dry dehiscent pericarp or fruit that is composed of one or more carpels
{bc}a tapered and roughly cylindrical body of ore or mineral
{bc}a usually protective container or housing: such as
{bc}a streamlined compartment (as for fuel) under the wings or fuselage of an aircraft
{bc}a compartment (as for personnel, a power unit, or an instrument) on a ship or craft

shortdef: a dry dehiscent pericarp or fruit that is composed of one or more carpels; especially : legume

dt: {bc}a number of animals (such as whales) clustered together

{bc}a usually small group of people (such as family members, friends, coworkers, or classmates) who regularly interact closely with one another but with few or no others in order to minimize exposure and reduce the transmission of infection during an outbreak of a contagious disease {bc}{sx|bubble:1|bubble:1|7b}

dt.t: If you're planning to celebrate with close family or friends who aren't in your quarantine {wi}pod{/wi}, there are a few ways to make sure your gathering is safe for everyone.
You can … share a beer tent you built in your backyard with your pandemic {wi}pod{/wi} or even have a neighborhood street party with everyone in their own front yards.
… oversaw the engineering of new processes … with … employees working in {wi}pods{/wi} so if someone became ill, only that group was affected.
For example, students are broken up into {wi}pods{/wi} throughout the day and in classrooms so if there is a COVID-19 case, it's easier for the school to contact trace and know who to keep home.

{wi}Pods{/wi}—a homeschooling option that puts students together in small groups as a way to share remote learning supervision and child care duties between their respective families—have caught on across the U.S. as school districts move classes online amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

shortdef: a number of animals (such as whales) clustered together

a usually small group of people (such as family members, friends, coworkers, or classmates) who regularly interact closely with one another but with few or no others in order to minimize exposure and reduce the transmission of infection during an outbreak of a contagious disease : bubble

dt: {bc}corn of a variety ({it}Zea mays tunicata{/it}) that has each individual kernel enclosed in a husk

shortdef: corn of a variety (Zea mays tunicata) that has each individual kernel enclosed in a husk

dt: used to say that two people or things are very similar to each other

dt.t: My brother and I are {it}two peas in a pod{/it}. We both like the same things.

shortdef: —used to say that two people or things are very similar to each other
